metadata.Title: CVE-2019-14902 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - low.
metadata.Description:
There is an issue in all samba 4.11.x versions before 4.11.5, all samba 4.10.x versions before 4.10.12 and all samba 4.9.x versions before 4.9.18, where the removal of the right to create or modify a subtree would not automatically be taken away on all domain controllers.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-14902` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ldb-tools - 2:4.11.5+dfsg-1ubuntu1
libldb2 - 2:4.11.5+dfsg-1ubuntu1
python3-ldb - 2:4.11.5+dfsg-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

ctdb - 2:4.11.5+dfsg-1ubuntu1
libnss-winbind - 2:4.11.5+dfsg-1ubuntu1
libpam-winbind - 2:4.11.5+dfsg-1ubuntu1
libsmbclient - 2:4.11.5+dfsg-1ubuntu1
libwbclient0 - 2:4.11.5+dfsg-1ubuntu1
python3-samba - 2:4.11.5+dfsg-1ubuntu1
registry-tools - 2:4.11.5+dfsg-1ubuntu1
samba - 2:4.11.5+dfsg-1ubuntu1
samba-ad-dc - 2:4.11.5+dfsg-1ubuntu1
samba-ad-provision - 2:4.11.5+dfsg-1ubuntu1
samba-common - 2:4.11.5+dfsg-1ubuntu1
samba-common-bin - 2:4.11.5+dfsg-1ubuntu1
samba-dsdb-modules - 2:4.11.5+dfsg-1ubuntu1
samba-libs - 2:4.11.5+dfsg-1ubuntu1
samba-testsuite - 2:4.11.5+dfsg-1ubuntu1
samba-vfs-modules - 2:4.11.5+dfsg-1ubuntu1
smbclient - 2:4.11.5+dfsg-1ubuntu1
winbind - 2:4.11.5+dfsg-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> difficult and risky backport to 4.3 in xenial. Workaround: Use of 'samba-tool drs replicate $DC1 $DC2 $NC --full-sync' will cause all ACLs to be syncronised from DC2 to DC1, for the given NC (naming context)

criterions.comment: samba package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:4.11.5+dfsg-1ubuntu1').
samba package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:4.11.5+dfsg-1ubuntu1').
